job_details.Functieomschrijving:
+ Gross monthly salary between EUR 4,331 and EUR 6,186 (scale 09) for a 36 hour week
          + Thirteenth month's salary and 8% holiday allowance
          + 10% Employee Benefit Budget
          + EUR 1,400 development budget per year
          + Hybrid working: balance between home and office work (possible for most roles)
          + A pension, for which you can set the maximum amount of your personal contribution
       Business Analyst - Test Automation Engineer
       Are you passionate about improving cross-border payments and processes? Do you have experience in functional testing and test automation? Then we are looking for you!
       Tribe Account & Payment Factory
       The Tribe Account & Payment Factory is responsible for Payment and Current Account processing and related services. In the Area of Transaction Processing, we deliver fast, reliable, and efficient transaction processing 24/7. To ensure that our services are always available, we are also renewing the payment factory, simplifying our payment landscape, decommissioning legacy systems, and migrating to the new tech stack. High service availability is key, and for a short impression of our Tribe, have a look at this video .
       Your Role
       Within the Area Transaction Processing, the Cross-Border Payments squad is looking for a Business Analyst with a focus on test and test automation. You will strive to continuously improve cross-border payments and processes, ensuring the continuity of this critical payment chain. The Cross-Border team works closely with a team of specialists from our vendor, as it is a vendor-bought application (a rule-based payment engine) on-premises., As the Test Expert within our squad, you will ensure that the Test Strategy aligns with the goals of the bank and the team. You will be actively involved in functionally testing the application and aligning/executing tests with other parties in the critical product chain. Additionally, you will work on setting up and maintaining a testing framework.
          + Functional Testing: Perform functional testing activities and maintain test tooling, testing environments, and test sets.
          + Application Monitoring: Continuity of a critical application in the payment landscape. Monitor the application and analyze & solve production issues (e.g., ad hoc requests from colleagues, business, and other applications in the chain, analyzing logging, making queries, etc.).
          + Product Backlog: Create Product Backlog Items and deliver input for the Product Owner and Tech Lead.
          + Change Processes: Provide operational requirements, safeguard operability, maintainability, robustness, and performance.
       Your Talents
job_details.full_text:
Business Analyst - Test Automation Engineer

+ Gross monthly salary between EUR 4,331 and EUR 6,186 (scale 09) for a 36 hour week
          + Thirteenth month's salary and 8% holiday allowance
          + 10% Employee Benefit Budget
          + EUR 1,400 development budget per year
          + Hybrid working: balance between home and office work (possible for most roles)
          + A pension, for which you can set the maximum amount of your personal contribution
       Business Analyst - Test Automation Engineer
       Are you passionate about improving cross-border payments and processes? Do you have experience in functional testing and test automation? Then we are looking for you!
       Tribe Account & Payment Factory
       The Tribe Account & Payment Factory is responsible for Payment and Current Account processing and related services. In the Area of Transaction Processing, we deliver fast, reliable, and efficient transaction processing 24/7. To ensure that our services are always available, we are also renewing the payment factory, simplifying our payment landscape, decommissioning legacy systems, and migrating to the new tech stack. High service availability is key, and for a short impression of our Tribe, have a look at this video .
       Your Role
       Within the Area Transaction Processing, the Cross-Border Payments squad is looking for a Business Analyst with a focus on test and test automation. You will strive to continuously improve cross-border payments and processes, ensuring the continuity of this critical payment chain. The Cross-Border team works closely with a team of specialists from our vendor, as it is a vendor-bought application (a rule-based payment engine) on-premises., As the Test Expert within our squad, you will ensure that the Test Strategy aligns with the goals of the bank and the team. You will be actively involved in functionally testing the application and aligning/executing tests with other parties in the critical product chain. Additionally, you will work on setting up and maintaining a testing framework.
          + Functional Testing: Perform functional testing activities and maintain test tooling, testing environments, and test sets.
          + Application Monitoring: Continuity of a critical application in the payment landscape. Monitor the application and analyze & solve production issues (e.g., ad hoc requests from colleagues, business, and other applications in the chain, analyzing logging, making queries, etc.).
          + Product Backlog: Create Product Backlog Items and deliver input for the Product Owner and Tech Lead.
          + Change Processes: Provide operational requirements, safeguard operability, maintainability, robustness, and performance.
       Your Talents

profile_classification.rationale: The job description focuses on business analysis, functional testing, and test automation within a payment processing context. It lacks any mention of AI, machine learning, generative models, or related engineering tasks, making it irrelevant to the GenAI Engineer profile.

phrases.phrase: improving cross-border payments and processes
phrases.justification: This phrase indicates an understanding of the business domain (payments) and the goal of improving existing processes, which aligns with understanding business context.

phrases.phrase: The Tribe Account & Payment Factory is responsible for Payment and Current Account processing and related services.
phrases.justification: This describes the business unit's function and responsibilities, demonstrating an understanding of the business context.

phrases.phrase: renewing the payment factory, simplifying our payment landscape, decommissioning legacy systems, and migrating to the new tech stack.
phrases.justification: These are strategic business initiatives related to the payment systems, requiring business understanding to align technical work.

phrases.phrase: ensure that our services are always available
phrases.justification: This highlights a key business requirement for service continuity and availability.

phrases.phrase: aligns with the goals of the bank and the team
phrases.justification: Explicitly states the need to connect technical activities (Test Strategy) with business objectives.

phrases.phrase: Create Product Backlog Items and deliver input for the Product Owner and Tech Lead.
phrases.justification: Involves translating requirements and needs into actionable items for development, requiring business understanding.

phrases.phrase: Provide operational requirements, safeguard operability, maintainability, robustness, and performance.
phrases.justification: Focuses on non-functional requirements that directly impact the business's ability to use and rely on the system.

job_tasks.justification: No specific tasks related to designing, building, or maintaining data pipelines or infrastructure were found.
The job description does not mention any activities related to creating, training, or adapting machine learning or generative models.

phrases.phrase: test automation
phrases.justification: While not traditional application development, setting up and maintaining test automation frameworks involves writing and managing code for testing purposes.

phrases.phrase: setting up and maintaining a testing framework
phrases.justification: This involves developing and managing the infrastructure and tools for testing, which can include scripting and software components.

phrases.phrase: maintain test tooling, testing environments, and test sets
phrases.justification: This involves managing and potentially developing aspects of the software used for testing.

phrases.phrase: analyzing logging, making queries, etc.
phrases.justification: This implies interacting with system logs and databases, which can involve writing queries and potentially scripting for analysis.

phrases.phrase: Application Monitoring
phrases.justification: Involves overseeing the performance and availability of a critical application in production.

phrases.phrase: Continuity of a critical application in the payment landscape.
phrases.justification: Focuses on ensuring the operational stability and availability of a production system.

phrases.phrase: Monitor the application and analyze & solve production issues
phrases.justification: Directly relates to monitoring and troubleshooting live production systems.

phrases.phrase: safeguard operability, maintainability, robustness, and performance.
phrases.justification: These are operational concerns focused on the health and performance of the system in production.

phrases.phrase: aligning/executing tests with other parties in the critical product chain.
deliver input for the Product Owner and Tech Lead.
ad hoc requests from colleagues, business, and other applications in the chain
migrating to the new tech stack.
analyze & solve production issues
making queries, etc.
strive to continuously improve cross-border payments and processes
As the Test Expert within our squad, you will ensure that the Test Strategy aligns with the goals of the bank and the team.
